revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=July 2007}} '''Occupation of factories''' is a method of the [[workers' movement]] used to prevent [[lock out]]s. They may sometimes lead to "recovered factories", in which the [[workers' self-management|workers self-manage]] the [[factories]].
They have been used in many [[strike action]]s, including:
*the 1920–22 ''[[Biennio rosso|Biennio Rosso]]'' (in particular the [[Turin factory occupation of 1920]]) *[[1936 French general strike]] (see [[1936 Matignon agreements]]) *in the [[May 68 revolts]], supported by the [[Council for Maintaining the Occupations]] *in the 1970s in Italy (35-day occupation of the [[Fiat]]) *upper Clyde shipbuilder workers staged a work-in during 1971-72 with about 260 further occupations in Britain in the following decade *the [[1971 Harco work-in]], Australia *[[Uruguay general strike, 1973|1973 Uruguayan general strike]] *[[Lip factory]] in France in 1973 *the occupation of the ceramics factory formerly known as Zanon in Argentina starting in 2001, that under workers' control changed its name to [[FaSinPat]] *the occupation of the [[Republic Windows and Doors]] factory in Chicago in 2008, and the re-occupation of the factory in 2012 *A 77-day occupation of the [[SsangYong Motor Company|Ssangyong]] car factory in 2009<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/8187542.stm |title=S Korea factory occupation ends |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-08-06 |accessdate=2010-02-12}}</ref> *Current occupation of Viomichaniki Metalleutiki in [[Thessaloniki]], [[Greece]], along the lines of factory occupations in Argentina.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thenation.com/article/greek-workers-take-over-factory-video-interview/|title=Greek Workers Take Over a Factory [Video Interview]|first=Laura|last=Flanders|publisher=|via=www.thenation.com}}</ref>
== Biennio Rosso == Radical unionism started after the first world war. The movement was a result of increasing internal commissions or "faculty councils". Around November 1918, the councils/commissions had morphed into a national problem. By February 1919, the federation of Italian metal workers had successfully received a contract permitting these commissions in their factories. In May 1919, these commissions began to transfer into councils that were managing the factories and were dominating the power structure of said workplaces. The contract also prevented democratic elections of these council members or "stewards". In April 1920, at Fiat, there was the beginning of sit-in strikes by the workers, which eventually grew to 500,000 workers striking at its peak.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://libcom.org/history/articles/italy-factory-occupations-1920|title=1918-1921: The Italian factory occupations and Biennio Rosso|website=libcom.org|access-date=2016-04-22}}</ref>
== The French General Strike == In France in January 1936, the PCF, a Stalinist communist organization spurred the creation of a coalition of radicals called the "popular front". This organization was designed to defend democracy and disassemble fascist bonds. In May 1936, the popular front won a majority election and assembled a cabinet of eighteen socialist, thirteen radicals and four independent socialist to govern. Communists supported the leaderrLeon Blum but refused to join the cabinet. This change in power was spurred by a massive general strike in the years preceding where thousands of factories had been occupied by French workers to ensure said democratic governance. Blum effectively ended the strike when this government came to power.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.workersliberty.org/node/6469|title=1936: “The French revolution has begun”|last=B|first=Simon|website=Workers' Liberty|access-date=2016-04-22}}</ref>
== May 68 Revolution == During a period of civil unrest in France in the 1960s, student protests were joined by factory occupations and strikes by French workers. See [[May 1968 events in France]].
== Fiat Occupation in Italy == In the 1960s, a historic movement of strikes and factory occupations had a significant effect on Italy. After constant failure by the government to follow through on promises for reform in Italy, a surge of uprising and strikes occurred between 1968 and 1970. Earlier strikes at northern factories in Turin were successful in gaining momentum in 1962. The Lancia factory walkout was successful in gaining some workers rights. The Michelin Factory strike around the same time had less success. A large strike in Turin however, amassing 93,000 of the Fiat workforce for a massive walkout and intimidation of those who did not participate. After further political negotiation and action through the years that followed, and unsatisfactory changes in policy coupled with increasingly educated and aware workers, the series of massive strikes broke out in 1968. The autumn of 1969 is considered the climax of these strikes and they continued through the early 1970s resulting in significantly improved conditions for Italian workers. In 1973, over 6 million workers were on strike.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://libcom.org/history/1962-1973-worker-student-struggles-italy|title=1962-1973: Worker and student struggles in Italy|website=libcom.org|access-date=2016-04-22}}</ref>
== Upper Clyde Ship Builder Work-In == The Upper Clyde Ship Builders are a Scottish shipbuilder consortium that was birthed in 1968 by an adjoining of 5 shipbuilders. It was liquidated in 1971 resulting in occupation/work-in campaign by shop stewards in shipyards. See [[Upper Clyde Shipbuilders]].
== Harco Work-In == The Harco work-in of 1971 was an occupation by steel plant workers in New South Wales, Australia. The 4-week long work-in was the result of a dispute between Harco owners and workers on company sacking and rehiring practices during low production periods to save money. See [[1971 Harco work-in]].
== Uruguayan General Strike == During 1973, a close of parliament and essential dictatorship by the president created unrest and the leftist union called for a general strike and occupation of factories. After two weeks most of the union leaders were in jail, exile, or dead. See [[1973 Uruguayan general strike]].
== French LIP Factory == When the LIP factory in France decided to close a factory due to financial problems in the late 60s and early 70s, strikes and a very public factory occupation eventually transferred control and management of the factory to the workers. See [[LIP (company)]]
== Zanon Factory Occupation == During the Argentine uprising of the early 2000s, there was a complete takeover of the Zanon tile factory in Argentina. The workers went on strike in the year 2000, the first of a series of strikes that was spurred by the death of a worker from a heart attack. They also were adamant about making their conflicts with the company very public. Workers traveled and occupied places other than factories as well. In January 2001, there was a 6-day strike over unpaid wages. In April 2001, there was a 34-day strike over outstanding wages. These strikes were followed by many other occupations and strikes that ultimately cause the factories to lose almost 50% of their production.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://libcom.org/library/zanon-factory-occupation-interview-with-workers|title=Zanon factory occupation - interview with workers|website=libcom.org|access-date=2016-04-22}}</ref>
== Republic Windows and Doors Occupation == When Republic Windows and Doors company was declared bankrupt in December 2008, an organized sit-own strike of 200 workers in the factory occurred to protest federal labor law violations by the company.
== Ssangyong Car Factory Occupation == A long occupation of the Ssangyong car factory by 900 factory workers and several thousand others began on May 22, 2009 after a list of firings was released by the company that showed over 1000 workers to be laid off. This was the result of the company filing for bankruptcy in February 2009. Workers were essentially sieged by the company during their occupation and workers refused all company negotiations that did not include jobs.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.wsws.org/en/articles/2009/07/kore-j01.html|title=South Korea: Clashes erupt at Ssangyong factory occupation - World Socialist Web Site|last=Cook|first=Terry|website=www.wsws.org|access-date=2016-04-22}}</ref>
== See also == *[[Sit-down strike]] *[[Bolivarian Circles]] *[[History of Solidarity]] *[[History of Argentina]] and "[[Dirty War]]"
== References == {{Reflist}}
{{Organized labor}}
[[Category:Labour movement]] [[Category:Labor relations]] [[Category:History of social movements]] [[Category:Labor disputes]]

revision.comment: /* External links */ recat
revision.text:
The '''Olympics Triplecast''' was an experimental [[pay-per-view]] telecast in the [[United States of America|United States]] during the [[1992 Summer Olympics]] in [[Barcelona]], Spain. While an ambitious project, it was a massive financial failure.
==Overview and history== [[NBC]], which had broadcast rights to the Games,<ref group=Note name=Note01/><ref>{{cite web| url= http://jeff560.tripod.com/tv8.html | title= TV Broadcasting History – The World Comes Together in Your Living Room: The Olympics on TV| first= Joseph |last= Gallant | accessdate= 6 July 2015}}</ref> thought that viewers would be willing to pay US$95 to $170 to see events live, which would normally be shown on [[broadcast delay|tape delay]] on the network in [[prime time]]. It partnered with [[Cablevision]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nbcsports.com/our-history#decade_7|title=The 1992 Barcelona Olympics|last= |first= |date= |website=NBC Sports History Page|publisher= |access-date= |quote=}}</ref> the prominent New York cable provider, to create three channels: Red, White, and Blue. A special three-button [[remote control]] with the colors of the channels as the buttons was offered by some cable operators for free as a lure to sign up for the service.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20081010040835/http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_hb4895/is_199201/ai_n17999082 Article] at findarticles.com</ref> Channels aired twelve hours a day (from 5 a.m. to 5 p.m. [[Eastern Time Zone|ET]]) then repeated their content for the other twelve hours.<ref name="nyt71792">"Triplecast Ads Are Cited." ''New York Times'' 17 Jul. 1992: 10.</ref> Programs came from the world feed.<ref>Sarni, Jim. [http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/1992-07-27/news/9202210808_1_triplecast-click-balance-beam "Quick Remote Trigger Is A Triplecast Must"], ''Miami Sun-Sentinel'', 27 July 1992.</ref> As an inducement for people to order the Triplecast, NBC featured star announcers and pundits, such as [[Chick Hearn]] for basketball. This was nothing new for NBC as the network employed [[Vin Scully]] for its [[World Series]] telecasts.<ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hCkYon5qjWI</ref>
===Channel programs=== * The Blue channel featured [[Swimming at the 1992 Summer Olympics|swimming]] events during the first week and [[Athletics at the 1992 Summer Olympics|track and field]] events during the second week. * The White channel featured many individual sports, such as [[Gymnastics at the 1992 Summer Olympics|gymnastics]], [[Boxing at the 1992 Summer Olympics|boxing]], [[Rowing at the 1992 Summer Olympics|rowing]], [[Equestrian at the 1992 Summer Olympics|equestrian]] and other minor sports. * The Red channel featured team sports, such as [[Boxing at the 1992 Summer Olympics|basketball]], [[Baseball at the 1992 Summer Olympics|baseball]], [[Volleyball at the 1992 Summer Olympics|volleyball]], [[Water polo at the 1992 Summer Olympics|water polo]], and [[Handball at the 1992 Summer Olympics|team handball]].
==Issues== Several issues plagued the Triplecast.
===Logistics=== Cable providers took a lower profit cut than they normally do for pay-per-view events. A national center was also set up (1-800-OLYMPIC) to take calls, but it often had trouble telling if a viewer's cable system was participating. In January 1992, for instance, [[Chuck Dolan]], head of Cablevision, tested the ordering system, which could not tell if his Cablevision Long Island system was carrying the Triplecast.<ref name="nyt62992">Sandomir, Richard. [https://www.nytimes.com/1992/06/29/sports/olympics-triplecast-an-olympian-blunder-or-innovation.html "OLYMPICS; Triplecast: An Olympian Blunder or Innovation?"], ''The New York Times'', 29 June 1992.</ref>
===Low uptake=== The biggest issue with ''Triplecast'' was low uptake. NBC estimated two million people would subscribe to the programming.<ref name="time">Zoglin, Richard; Ty, William. "How Much Is Too Much?" ''TIME'' 10 Aug. 1992: 64.</ref> But ''TripleCast'' projections were around 200,000-250,000, and the ''Pay-Per-View Update'' industry newsletter estimated only 125,000. Early reports of slow sales even inspired [[David Letterman]], then still at NBC, to make jokes about the ''Triplecast''.<ref name="time"/> Midway through the games, discounts were applied for one-day service and weekend packages were added. But the attempts to boost subscription largely failed. Another attempt to boost interest was made, by airing a three-way [[split screen (film)|split screen]] of the ''TripleCast'' channels in hour-long blocks on [[CNBC]], but with no audio.<ref>{{cite web| url= http://sportsrantz.com/media/2012/07/25/olympics-triplecast/| title= 20 Years After: The Olympics Triplecast| author= Diamond Joe |date= 25 July 2012 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20120804160207/http://sportsrantz.com/media/2012/07/25/olympics-triplecast/| deadurl= yes| accessdate= 6 July 2015| archivedate= 4 August 2012}}</ref>
The final tally of ''Olympics Triplecast'' subscribers was 200,000.<ref>{{cite news| url= http://london2012.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/07/25/happy-anniversary-triplecast/ | title= Happy Anniversary, Triplecast | last= Sandomir| first= Richard| date= 25 July 2012| work= The New York Times ''blog''| accessdate= 6 July 2015 }}</ref> It was enough of a flop that Chuck Dolan was already acknowledging by August 6 that "the public didn't find enough incremental value for the ''Triplecast'' over what they could get on NBC" and that "we blew it from an economic point of view." It also surfaced that research figures were enhanced. While one percent of surveyed viewers said they would "definitely" buy the ''TripleCast'', that number was enhanced in press materials by adding those who declared they would "probably" buy the service.<ref name="sandomir8692">Sandomir, Richard. "BARCELONA; Overpricing of Olympics' Triplecast Service Is Acknowledged", ''The New York Times'' 6 Aug. 1992: 14.</ref>
===Cannibalizing the main coverage=== The TripleCast service took a very austere, no-frills approach to broadcasting that included play-by-play and commentary, but few graphics and absolutely no feature stories or background vignettes. According to some TripleCast viewers, this made the main NBC coverage seem "schmaltzy and overproduced".<ref name="time"/> In addition, NBC's main coverage was denigrated to some extent, with Triplecast viewers knowing some results 10 hours or more before the events were aired on the main network.
===Advertising=== Original Triplecast advertising promoted that the service was "live with no interruptions" — though half of the broadcast day was a repeat. The New York City Consumer Affairs Department charged NBC and Cablevision with deception in advertising as a result.<ref name="nyt71792"/> Eventually, the parties settled, with NBC and Cablevision agreeing to clarify the advertising.<ref>"OLYMPICS; Settlement In Triplecast Ads." ''The New York Times'' 22 July 1992: 10.</ref> In addition, about 10 percent of NBC's 205 affiliates refused to run Triplecast advertising because they did not want to promote competition for their broadcast.<ref name="nyt62992"/>
==Legacy== Even before the Olympics started, many criticized the business model. On July 16, nine days before the Opening Ceremony, one ''[[Philadelphia Inquirer]]'' writer called it "the biggest marketing disaster since [[New Coke]]".<ref>Macnow, Glen. [http://articles.philly.com/1992-07-16/sports/26025616_1_nbc-s-triplecast-nbc-chief-executive-olympic-coverage-nbc "Triplecast May Be A National Failure At This Year's Games NBC Needs A Huge Viewing Audience To Make Its $401 Million Gamble On The Olympics Pay Off. So Far, It's Not Even Close."], ''Philadelphia Inquirer'', 16 July 1992.</ref> The Triplecast was deemed by ''[[The New York Times]]'' "sports TV's biggest flop" and that NBC and Cablevision were "bereft in sanity" in operating it.<ref>Sandomir, Richard. "Click, Click, Click: The Year In Gaffes", ''The New York Times'' 25 December 1992: 8.</ref> By 1994, it was referred to as "the ''[[Heaven's Gate (film)|Heaven's Gate]]'' of television".<ref>Sandomir, Richard. "SPORTS BUSINESS; Some Shaky Precedents for New York Sports Fans." ''New York Times'' 28 Aug. 1994: 35.</ref> Albert Kim, the editor of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'', went on [[National Public Radio]] and called it "an unmitigated disaster for NBC".<ref>DePrez, Greg. [http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-18601621.html "The Olympics TripleCast: still revolutionary, still relevant"], ''Multichannel News'' 22 June 1996.</ref> It was a loss of about $100 million (half of which was covered by Cablevision under agreement) for the two parties. It also shaped NBC's strategies in the coverage of future Olympics.
NBC did not use pay-per-view to cover any future games. While NBC alone broadcast the [[1996 Summer Olympic Games]] in the United States, NBC decided to use [[cable television]] partners for its subsequent telecasts. [[Olympics on CBS|CBS]], which had the broadcast rights to the [[1994 Winter Olympic Games|1994]] and [[1998 Winter Olympic Games]], also used a cable partner, [[Olympics on TNT|TNT]].
*[[CNBC]] and [[MSNBC]] showed the [[2000 Summer Olympics|2000 Summer Games]] and [[2002 Winter Olympic Games|2002 Winter Games]] along with NBC, and three newer acquisitions ([[Bravo (US TV network)|Bravo]] and [[USA Network]] in English and [[Telemundo]] in Spanish) joined the coverage for the [[2004 Summer Olympics|2004 Summer Games]]. [[Universal HD]] was added for the [[2006 Winter Olympics|2006 Winter Games]]. This arrangement continued, with [[Oxygen (TV network)|Oxygen]] taking the place of Bravo for the 2008 Games, and excluded from the 2010 Games due to a lack of programming (NBC's digital subchannel [[Universal Sports]] began to air analysis shows during those Games). The [[NBC Sports Network]] showed all U.S. Olympic events in the [[2012 Olympic Games]]. *For the [[2008 Summer Olympics]], NBC offered to cable operators the NBC Olympic Basketball Channel and NBC Olympic Soccer Channel, which broadcast exclusively in [[high definition television|high definition]] and aired all the events in both sports without any commercial interruptions. During halftimes and before each game, a wide-angle shot of the venue from the default world feed was shown instead along with highlights without commentary, while non-programming hours consisted of rolling statistics or a [[test pattern]]; later years now feature a continuous loop of the previous day's action. The network also used the same setup for the [[2012 Summer Olympics|2012]] and [[2016 Summer Olympics|2016]] Games.<ref>{{cite news| url= https://www.engadget.com/2012/05/27/nbc-london-olympics-2012-streaming-tv-3d/ | title= NBC lays out 2012 London Olympics broadcast plan on TV, internet, apps and in 3D | first= Richard |last= Lawler |work= Engadget| date= 27 May 2012| accessdate= 6 July 2015}}</ref> *During the 2008 Summer Olympics, NBC also streamed 2,200 hours of 25 different sports live on [http://www.nbcolympics.com NBCOlympics.com]. Most events shown on NBCOlympics.com were shown with no commentary. The number of hours of coverage has expanded further for each succeeding Games. *For the 2018 Winter Olympics, the addition of the new [[Olympic Channel (United States)|Olympic Channel]] will allow further expansion overall to the network's schedule of coverage.
NBC currently holds the U.S. rights to the Olympics through 2032.
==Notes== {{reflist|group=Note|refs= <ref name=Note01>By 1992, televising the Olympics had become a costly proposition. NBC won the rights to the Summer Games in Barcelona with a bid of $401 million, thinking ABC and CBS were both going to bid $400 million each (in the end, the highest rival bid was closer to $ 300 million). In an attempt to recoup the cost, NBC decided, in addition to its own extensive over-the-air TV coverage, to partner with Cablevision Systems Corporation (who were joint owners of [[Rainbow Programming Holdings]], parent company to several cable networks) and produce round-the-clock (twelve hours live each day, then repeated for the next twelve hours) coverage of other Olympic events on three pay-per-view channels. The venture was a financial disaster, with NBC and Cablevision each losing about $50 million each.</ref> }}
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== {{Portal|1990s}} *[http://www.mit.edu/afs/net.mit.edu/user/tytso/usenet/usa-today/bonus/137 Usenet posting of a ''USA Today'' article following the Barcelona Olympics] *[https://www.nytimes.com/1991/05/28/sports/olympics-tv-sports-ebersol-says-he-s-ready-for-pay-per-view-time.html?pagewanted=1 OLYMPICS: TV SPORTS; Ebersol Says He's Ready for Pay-Per-View Time] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20110827192209/http://sportstvtube.blogspot.com/2011/06/remembering-olympics-triplecast.html The Sports Tube: Remembering The Olympics Triplecast]
{{Olympics on NBC}}

{{coi|date=May 2018}} {{Orphan|date=February 2009}} {{notability|date=May 2018}} {{Infobox company | name = PROGNOZ | logo = Logo prognoz.jpg | type = [[Private company|Private]] | foundation = 1991 | location = [[Perm]], [[Russia]] | key_people = Dmitry L. Andrianov, CEO | num_employees = 1500 (2016) | industry = [[business intelligence]], [[business performance management|performance management]], [[data management]] | products = PROGNOZ 8 Platform| homepage = [http://www.prognoz.com/ http://www.prognoz.com] }} '''PROGNOZ''' is a privately held company based in [[Perm]], [[Russia]] that develops business [[software]].{{cite web|url = http://www.idc-cema.com/?showproduct=29950&action=Partners&content_lang=ENG|title = www.idc-cema.com/?showproduct=29950&action=Partners&content_lang=ENG|deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070929000822/http://www.idc-cema.com/?showproduct=29950&action=Partners&content_lang=ENG|archivedate = 2007-09-29|df = }} The company’s software is commonly categorized in the [[business intelligence]] or [[business process management]] market segments.{{cite web|url = http://www.informationweek.com/showArticle.jhtml?articleID=187001912|title = www.informationweek.com/showArticle.jhtml?articleID=187001912}} In addition to its headquarters in Perm, PROGNOZ has offices in [[Beijing]], [[Brussels]], [[Moscow]], and [[Washington, D.C.|Washington]]. The company name derives from the Russian word for “forecast.”{{cite web|url = http://www.rususa.com/dictionary/russian.asp|title = www.rususa.com/dictionary/russian.asp}} == History == PROGNOZ was founded as the result of a [[Soviet Union|Soviet]]-era collaboration between the Russian Academy of Science and the Ministry of the Economy. In 1987, a team of economists and scientists from the Academy’s Institute of Economics gathered at Perm State University to conduct a series of economic forecasting projects for the Ministry. Four years later, after the establishment of the Russian Federation opened the national economy, one of these economists, Dmitry L. Andrianov, founded PROGNOZ to address the need for business software that analyzed and forecast economic information. (Andrianov continues to serve as PROGNOZ’s CEO today). A year later, in 1992, PROGNOZ introduced the PROGNOZ Analytical Suite, a software application for statistical analysis and econometric modeling, and a predecessor to the PROGNOZ 5 Platform. In 2001, PROGNOZ expanded its operations from Perm and opened an office in Moscow. This expansion continued in 2006 with offices in Beijing, Philadelphia, Washington DC, Kiev and other locations.{{cite web|url = http://www.prognoz.com|title = www.prognoz.com}} Since 2012, [[Gartner|Gartner, Inc.]], the world’s leading information technology research and advisory company, has included Prognoz in the Magic Quadrant for Business Intelligence and Analytics Platforms* report. Since 2015, Gartner, Inc. has included Prognoz in the Magic Quadrant for Advanced Analytics Platforms** report. == Products == The company’s main software application is the [[Prognoz Platform]]. The Prognoz Platform is a cutting-edge BI platform for building information systems. It can also be used as a standalone product. Prognoz Platform organizes and analyzes business and [[macroeconomic]] data, and can create [[econometric]] models based on datasets.{{cite web|url = http://www.prognoz.com/en/solutions.php|title = www.prognoz.com|deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070902124821/http://www.prognoz.com/en/solutions.php|archivedate = 2007-09-02|df = }} Most of standard and custom solutions are built on top of this platform. == Industry recognition and awards == 2015 Magic Quadrant for Business Intelligence and Analytics Platforms{{Cite web|title = Magic Quadrant for Business Intelligence and Analytics Platforms|url = http://www.gartner.com/technology/reprints.do?id=1-2ACLP1P&ct=150220&st=sb|website = www.gartner.com|access-date = 2016-01-15}} The largest suppliers of BI-solutions in Russia in 2015 {{Cite web|title = Издание о высоких технологиях - CNews|url = http://www.cnews.ru/reviews/bi_bigdata_2015/review_table/87ac7f32eef25ca0b8e41ef213c9156299fc474b/|website = CNews.ru|access-date = 2016-01-15}} #1 in Total Supply-Side Revenue on the Custom Application Development Foundation Market in Russia, 2014 according to IDC {{Cite web|title = Рейтинги {{!}} prognoz.ru|url = http://www.prognoz.ru/company/ratings|website = www.prognoz.ru|access-date = 2016-01-15}} == References ==
== External links == * [http://www.prognoz.com/ Official site] [[Category:Business intelligence companies]] [[Category:Software companies of Russia]] [[Category:Companies based in Perm]]

{{Spanish name|Peralta|Ramos}} [[File:Peralta ramos.jpg|thumb|Patricio Peralta Ramos]] '''Patricio Peralta Ramos''' (May 17, 1814{{spaced ndash}}April 25, 1887) was an Argentine businessman and landowner prominent in the foundation of the seaside city of [[Mar del Plata]].
==Life and times== Patricio Peralta Ramos was born in the [[San Nicolás, Buenos Aires|San Nicolás]], a [[Buenos Aires]] neighbourhood, in 1814. His father, José de Peralta, was a high-ranking official of the [[1st Infantry Regiment (Argentina)|Patricios Regiment]]. In 1860, he married a distant relative, Cecilia Ramos, with whom he had twelve children.
Peralta Ramos became a large clothing supplier to the [[Argentine Army]] during the 1829-52 regime of Governor [[Juan Manuel de Rosas]], of whom Peralta Ramos became an official supporter in 1842. A wealthy man by the time of Rosas' overthrow at the 1852 [[Battle of Caseros]], he traveled in 1860 to the Atlantic Ocean shore, where he purchased over 136,000 hectares (340,000 acres) from [[Portugal|Portuguese]] Consul and entrepreneur José Coelho de Meyrelles, and a meat salting house.<ref name=punto>[http://www.puntomardelplata.com/historia-marplatense.asp ''Punto Mar del Plata: Reseña histórica marplatense'' {{es icon}}]</ref>
His [[Jerky (food)|beef jerky]] facility struggling, Peralta Ramos embarked on the initial real estate development of his vast, scenic land. His enterprise met with the resistance of the gentry of [[Balcarce, Buenos Aires|Balcarce]] (then the county seat), though in 1865, he obtained a favorable ruling for the shoreline development from the local [[Justice of Peace]], Juan Peña. Seizing on a discrepancy between Peralta Ramos' holdings and what appeared in the official appraisal, Balcarce founder and Mayor José Chaves nearly forced his adversary to relocate his planned development on [[marshland]], but an 1867 letter in Peralta Ramos' support by neighboring [[Mar Chiquita]] Judge José Bernal to [[Buenos Aires Province]] official [[Nicolás Avellaneda]] settled the dispute in Peralta Ramos' favor.<ref name=punto/> [[File:Playa Bristol - Mar del Plata- Ca 1910.jpg|left|thumb|232px|Mar del Plata's Bristol Beach, around 1910]] Advertising the development as ''Puerto de la Laguna de los Padres,'' the sale of allotments was successful, and in 1873, Peralta Ramos petitioned the province for the seaside hamlet's incorporation, which was granted by Governor [[Mariano Acosta (politician)|Mariano Acosta]] on February 10, 1874, as ''Puerto Balcarce''. As this nomenclature was assigned over his objections, Peralta Ramos unofficially christened the community ''Mar del Plata'' (in the sense of "Sea of the [[Rio de la Plata basin|River Plate region]]").<ref>''Creemos, sin embargo, que por ser el primer contacto que los hombres del Río de la Plata tomaron con el mar se llamó a este punto precisamente mar "del Plata".'' Cova, Roberto Osvaldo:''Síntesis histórica de Mar del Plata: notas para el conocimiento del origen, evolución y desarrollo de la ciudad y de la zona.'' 1969, p. 8 {{es}}</ref>
The accomplishment was clouded, however, by the death of his wife, Cecilia, in honor of whom Peralta Ramos personally designed and built the [[Saint Cecilia]] Chapel; the structure, poignantly, was built by the mourning widower from wooden planks salvaged from a recent wreckage.<ref>[http://www.turismania.com.ar/DESCUBRA/pages/fundacion/fundacion.asp ''Turismania: Fundación de Mar del Plata'' {{es icon}}] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091008181100/http://www.turismania.com.ar/DESCUBRA/pages/fundacion/fundacion.asp |date=2009-10-08 }}</ref>
Boasting seaside appeal, an iron [[pier]] and made self-sufficient by the salting house, as well as by a flour mill, bakery, blacksmith and other establishments, the community prospered. In his later years, Peralta Ramos promoted the hunt of the area's then-vast herds of [[South American Sea Lion|sea lions]], which he termed "an inexhaustible source of wealth."<ref>''Centenario del natalicio del fundador de Mar del Plata Don Patricio Peralta Ramos.''</ref>
He died in Mar del Plata in 1887, and his remains were buried initially at Saint Cecilia chapel and some years later reburied at the [[La Recoleta Cemetery]] in Buenos Aires.
==References== {{reflist}}
{{Authority control}}

{{refimprove|date=December 2012}} {{Infobox video game | title = Pocket Planes | image = File:Pocket Planes App Logo.png | caption = Pocket Planes icon | developer = [[NimbleBit]] | publisher = NimbleBit | platforms = [[iOS]]
[[Android (operating system)|Android]] (until September 2015) | released = June 14, 2012 (iOS)
September 22, 2012 (Android) | genre = [[Simulation video game|Simulation]] | modes = [[Single player video game|Single player]] }} '''''Pocket Planes''''' is a business [[simulation video game]] developed by [[NimbleBit]] for [[iOS]]. It was initially released on June 14, 2012. In October 2012, the game became available on the [[Mac App Store]]. An [[Android (operating system)|Android]] version, [[porting|ported]] and published by [[Mobage]], was released on September 22, 2012. The game was removed on September 24, 2015 from the [[Google Play|Google Play Store]] but is still available on [[App Store (iOS)|iOS App Store]]. The app has also been removed from the U.K. [[App Store (iOS)|iOS App Store]] but is still available on the U.S App Store. ==Gameplay== [[File:Pocket Planes Gameplay Screenshot.jpg|thumb|A screenshot depicting a plane that has landed at an airport.|alt=A screenshot depicting a plane that has landed at an airport.|275x275px]] In ''Pocket Planes'', players assume the role of an [[airline]] CEO. Starting with a few airports and small planes, players transport small amounts of [[cargo]] and [[passenger]]s short distances. As they slowly gain profit from their flights, they then build more airports, buy better planes, and expand their airline internationally.{{cite web|last=Rigney|first=Ryan|title=Review: Pocket Planes‘ Airy Gameplay Doesn’t Fly|url=https://www.wired.com/gamelife/2012/06/review-pocket-planes-airy-gameplay-doesnt-fly/|work=Wired: Game{{!}}Life|publisher=Wired.com|accessdate=4 February 2014}} A formula determines how much profit will be earned from a flight, depending on the distance, speed and the weight of the plane used on the route. Filling a plane with items or people going to the same destination will net a 25% bonus on each item. Players can also complete events that involve flying special items and people to a designated destination. After completing these events, players are awarded Bux, which are used to buy planes and purchase other perks such as upgrades and the ability to speed up flights.{{Citation needed|date=October 2015}} ==Shutdown for Android== On September 24, 2015, the company that ported the game to Android, [[Mobage]], shut down their game servers for Pocket Planes and other NimbleBit games including [[Pocket Frogs]] and [[Tiny Tower]], and subsequently removed these downloads from the [[Google Play Store]]. There are no plans to bring it back, and the data from the Android game cannot be transferred to the iOS version. NimbleBit has announced that future sequels or a major update may see a re-release for the game to Android.{{cite web|url=http://support.nimblebit.com/customer/en/portal/articles/2103500-android-version-shutdown|title=Android Version Shutdown|publisher=NimbleBit Support Center|date=4 October 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160505103256/http://support.nimblebit.com/customer/en/portal/articles/2103500-android-version-shutdown|archive-date=5 May 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://support.nimblebit.com/customer/en/portal/articles/2215443-where-did-pocket-planes-for-android-go-|title=Where Did Pocket Planes for Android Go?|publisher=NimbleBit Support Center}} ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | MC = 78%{{cite web| title = Pocket Planes for iPhone/iPad reviews| url = http://www.metacritic.com/game/ios/pocket-planes|work=Metacritic}} | rev1 = ''[[Pocket Gamer]]'' | rev1Score = 9/10{{cite web| title = Pocket Planes review| url = http://www.pocketgamer.co.uk/r/Multiformat/Pocket+Planes/review.asp?c=41992|first=Harry|last=Slater|date=14 June 2012|work=PocketGamer}} | rev2 = ''[[TouchArcade]]'' | rev2Score = {{rating|5|5}}{{cite web| title ='Pocket Planes' Review - Now Boarding for NimbleBit's Next Classic| url = http://toucharcade.com/2012/06/13/the-pocket-planes-review/|first=Brad|last=Nicholson|date=13 June 2012|work=TouchArcade}} | rev3 = Jay Is Games | rev3Score = {{rating|4.5|5}}{{cite web|title = Pocket Planes Review|url = http://jayisgames.com/review/pocket-planes.php|date=15 June 2012|work=Jay Is Games}} | rev4 = [[Gamezebo]] | rev4Score = {{rating|4.5|5}}{{cite web |url=https://www.gamezebo.com/2012/06/14/pocket-planes-review/ |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180405001507/https://www.gamezebo.com/2012/06/14/pocket-planes-review/|archivedate=5 April 2018|title=Pocket Planes Review|first=Eli|last=Cymet|date=14 June 2012|work=[[Gamezebo]]|accessdate=5 April 2018}} }} The game was viewed favourably by reviewers. It holds a 78/100 score on the aggregate [[Metacritic]], categorising it as "Generally favorable reviews" based on 17 reviewers. Gamezebo.com rated it 4.5 stars out of 5, stating "Nimblebit has once again dropped you in the middle of a universe that feels like it was built just for you, and filled it with a deeper, more compelling mission". However, Ryan Rigney of [[Wired (website)|''Wired'']] wrote that the player's success did not correlate with skill, and criticises it for a lack of compelling gameplay. ==See also== * [[Pocket Frogs]] * [[Pocket Trains]] * [[Tiny Tower]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.nimblebit.com/ NimbleBit Official Website] [[Category:2012 video games]] [[Category:Business simulation games]] [[Category:IOS games]] [[Category:Android (operating system) games]] [[Category:Video games developed in the United States]]

revision.text:
{{Tone|date=October 2011}} {{Infobox software |name = ROSA |caption = RCA Open-Source Application |logo = ROSAlogo.jpg |logo size = 175px |screenshot = |developer = Alta Via Consulting, LLC. |latest release version = 1.0 |latest release date = {{release date|2010|5|11}} |operating_system = [[Cross-platform]], [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[Linux]], [[Unix]], [[Mac OS X]] | programming language = |genre = [[Accounting software|Accounting]] |license = [[GNU General Public License]] |website = [http://www.rcainstitute.org/ www.rcainstitute.org], or [http://www.altavia.com/ www.altavia.com] }} '''RCA Open-Source Application''' ('''ROSA''') is an [[open-source software|open-source]] management accounting application that aims to provide decision support information to managers. [[Resource consumption accounting]] (RCA) is a principle-based approach to [[management accounting]] that combines German management accounting techniques known as [[Grenzplankostenrechnung]] (GPK) with a disciplined form of activity-based costing.
ROSA uses resource consumption accounting (RCA) which is internationally recognized as the most robust form of cost management measurement for providing marginal cost analytics.<ref>[[International Federation of Accountants]] (IFAC) [http://web.ifac.org/publications/professional-accountants-in-business-committee/information-papers-1#evaluating-the-costing-jour|costing assessment of Resource Consumption Accounting]</ref>
ROSA is classified as a non-web open-source application, bringing many of the key modeling techniques of the RCA model to life. It provides a hands-on approach allowing the user complete interactive modeling capabilities. All the necessary files (databases, applications, manuals, storyboard etc.) as outlined in the bullet points below, have been collected into one compressed downloadable zip folder. The application uses [[Microsoft Excel]] as its primary interface, thus the learning curve is greatly accelerated due to the familiarity factor.
==Purpose of ROSA Project== In 2009, it was determined that a hands-on RCA model would be an effective way to demonstrate how RCA works. The ROSA application answers this need, and was designed as an interactive tool to aid in better understanding the principles and costing approach of [[resource consumption accounting]]. ROSA should be viewed as a ''cost planning and analysis tool'' and not as a ''pricing/profitability application''.
The ROSA open-source package contains: *''ROSA manual'' – To start the install process, double-click Autorun (Application) in the ROSA_USB compressed zip folder. *''Palo For Excel installation file'' *''ROSA base model database'' (pre-configured model) *''ROSA sample database'' (blank model) *''Excel application file'' *''Visual Storyboard'' Note: The Palo BI Suite support material should be used in conjunction with the ROSA Manual where necessary, particularly in areas concerning Palo installation, set-up and operation.
==Features== [[Image:ROSAfront.jpg|thumb|right|525px|''ROSA Copyright 2010 Alta Via Consulting, LLC'']] ROSA uses the business intelligence (BI) application called [[Palo (OLAP database)|Palo]]. Palo allows the ROSA base model database to be pre-configured so that the user can explore the look and feel of how a RCA model functions. {{Wikibooks|RCA Open Source Application: ROSA Manual}}
Some of the primary features of the RCA open-source application are:
*RCA modeling **cost objects in an RCA model **planning a cost object's output and primary costs **relationships in an RCA model **storyboard of a pharmaceutical company *Analysis of **product costs **resource pools and business processes **fixed and proportional rates *Maintaining **resource pools and business processes **products **primary costs **secondary costs (internal consumption) **capacity **rate calculation *Configuring **importing of master data and planning data values
==Limitations== There are certain cost modeling limitations inherent in the ROSA application. These limitations are specific to Version 1.0 of the ROSA application and should not be viewed as static. In other cases, customized versions of ROSA have been developed to fulfill client-specific requests addressing their firm’s individual costing requirements.
*''No ‘actual’ costs'' – ROSA is a stand-alone application and does not have integrated links to import data. It supports the construction of an RCA model for cost planning and analysis. ROSA does not currently support the comparison of actual to plan within the application. The planning aspect allows for the definition of consumption relationships with operational resource quantities, valuing the resource quantities with dollars, and calculating product and service costs. *''Excess/idle capacity'' – There is a limited ability to isolate excess/idle capacity in the application. The application currently deals only with planned information and is therefore not able to provide information on actual excess/idle capacity. *''Model size limitation'' – The ROSA model was designed for optimum use for businesses with limited size RCA applications. However, the underlying database and technology used in this model is extremely scalable. *''No profitability reporting'' – Rosa Version 1.0 is solely for the purposes of cost modeling. Customer or product revenue cannot be accommodated in this Version 1.0 of the application and reports on customer or product profitability are not provided.
To experience the full benefits that [[Resource Consumption Accounting]] has to offer as a dynamic, fully integrated, principle-based approach, a more robust and integrated software application must be used. The most widely used software applications for RCA are [[SAP AG]] ERP system and macs Controlling.
==Architecture== This application uses an open-source [[Business intelligence]] software engine called [[Palo (OLAP database)]], published by [http://www.jedox.com/en/home/overview.html Jedox AG]. Palo has been designed as an [[Add-in]] to spreadsheet software (i.e., [[Microsoft Excel]]).
==References== {{reflist}}
==Sources== *{{cite journal|author=Professional Accountants in Business|title=Evaluating and Improving Costing in Organizations|journal=International Federation of Accountants|issue=July|year=2009|pages=40|isbn=978-1-60815-037-3}} *{{cite journal|last=Clinton|first=B.D.|author2=Anton van der Merwe|title=Management Accounting – Approaches, Techniques, and Management Processes|journal=Cost Management|volume=20|number=Number 3|date=May–June 2006|pages=14–22|issn=1092-8057}} *{{cite journal|last=Clinton|first=B. D.|author2=Anton van der Merwe|title=Understanding Resource Consumption and Cost Behavior Part I: The Blended Cost Concept Error|journal=Cost Management|volume=22|number=Number 3|date=May–June 2008|pages=33–39|issn=1092-8057}} *{{cite journal|last=Clinton|first=B. D.|author2=Anton van der Merwe|title=Understanding Resource Consumption and Cost Behavior Part II: Operational Modeling and the Principle of Responsiveness|journal=Cost Management|volume=22|number=Number 4|date=Jul–August 2008|pages=14–20|issn=1092-8057}}
==External links== {{Wikibooks|RCA Open Source Application: ROSA Manual}} {{Portal|Free software}} *{{cite web|url=http://www.rcainstitute.org|title=RCA Institute, official web site}} *{{cite web|url=http://www.altavia.com/publications.php|title=Alta Via Consulting, LLC., ROSA developers}} *{{cite web|url=http://www.jedox.com/en/home/overview.html|title=Jedox, Palo BI Suite}} *{{cite web|url=http://www.macscontrolling.com|title=macs Controlling Software web site}} *{{cite web|url=http://www.sap.com/index.epx|title=SAP AG web site}}
{{Accounting software}}

{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2011}} {{Infobox person | name = Samba Bathily | image = President Conde0049+.jpg | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1971|10|23|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Bamako]], [[Mali]] | occupation = Co-Founder of [[Akon Lighting Africa]]
Chief Executive Officer of Solektra International }} '''Samba Bathily''' is a [[Mali]]an [[entrepreneur]], [[philanthropist]] from [[Bamako]]. He is also [[chief executive officer]] of “Solektra International” and co-founder of [[Akon Lighting Africa]]. ==Career == In 2014, Samba co-founded [[Akon Lighting Africa]]. This was launched with international music star Akon and Thione Niang.{{cite web|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/frontiers/2015/05/20/singer-akon-makes-progress-with-african-solar-power-venture/|title=Singer Akon Makes Progress With African Solar Power Venture|date=2015-05-20|accessdate=2015-09-23}} The objective of this initiative is to bring awareness around the use of solar solutions to provide villages throughout Africa with access to clean, renewable and reliable electricity. To date, results include a series of solar developments such as the installation of street lamps and domestic and community modern renewable energy solutions in 14 countries throughout Africa.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?t=17&v=MFPxL-Nz7fk|title=CNBC Africa - Akon to electrify Africa|date=2015-08-19|accessdate=2015-09-23}} Also launched in 2014 was Solektra International, a company that specializes in the planning, design, construction and maintenance of solar power systems. Samba is CEO and Co-founder with Akon and Thione Niang.{{cite web|url=http://solektra-international.com/management-team/samba-bathily-profile/|title=Samba Bathily|date=2015|accessdate=2015-09-22}} Solektra has a B2G (Business to Government) financing model that offers attractive and affordable repayment terms. Solektra International is the execution arm of Akon Lighting Africa with a goal to use local youths to implement projects while also fast tracking the social and economic development of Africa in cooperation with various international partners. Solektra International currently has a presence in 14 countries - [[Mali]], [[Senegal]], [[Niger]], [[Benin]], [[Sierra Leone]], [[Burkina-Faso]], [[Guinea]], [[Equatorial Guinea]], [[Gabon]], [[Congo-Brazzaville]], [[Nigeria]], [[Madagascar]], [[Namibia]]. Samba is soon to launch the “Solektra Solar Academy” to provide a pipeline of trained youth where they will develop skills and expertise in the field of solar energy. To be launched late 2015, this professional training institute targets future African entrepreneurs, engineers and technicians and will provide training on aspects of planning, design, construction and the maintenance of solar-powered electric systems and micro-grids.{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/06/03/akon-lighting-africa-to-bring-electricity-to-600-million-_n_7500156.html|title=Akon Lighting Africa's Solar Academy Hopes To Bring Electricity To 600 Million People|date=2015-03-06|accessdate=2015-09-23}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bathily, Samba}} [[Category:Malian businesspeople]] [[Category:Philanthropists]] [[Category:1971 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Bamako]] [[Category:Université catholique de Louvain alumni]] [[Category:Malian expatriates in Belgium]]

revision.comment: +{{[[Template:Authority control|Authority control]]}} (6 sources from Wikidata), [[WP:GenFixes]] on, using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
/* top */HTTP to HTTPS for [[Findlaw]], replaced: http://caselaw.findlaw.com/ → https://caselaw.findlaw.com/ using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{See|Socially responsible investing}}
With respect to public companies in the United States, a '''shareholder resolution''' is a proposal submitted by [[shareholders]] for a vote at the company's annual meeting. Typically, resolutions are opposed by the corporation's management, hence the insistence for a vote. For publicly held corporations in the United States, the submission and handling of resolutions is regulated by the [[Securities and Exchange Commission]] (SEC).
[[Shareholders]] submit resolutions dealing primarily with [[corporate governance]], such as [[executive compensation]], or [[corporate social responsibility]] issues, such as [[global warming]], [[labor relations]], [[tobacco smoking]], [[human rights]], and animal welfare.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://money.cnn.com/2006/04/25/magazines/fortune/pluggedin_fortune/|title=FORTUNE Magazine: Corporate America backs gay rights|accessdate=2008-03-09 | work=CNN | date=April 25, 2006 | first=Marc | last=Gunther}}</ref>
Virtually all shareholder resolutions are non-binding (or "precatory," to use the legal term of art).<ref>Monks, Robert A. and Nell Minow. ''Corporate Governance''. Blackwell Publishers, 2001.</ref> In this sense the voting on these resolutions more closely resembles a poll than it does a (binding) [[referendum]] or [[plebiscite]]. Still, media coverage of voting on shareholder resolutions tends to focus on whether the proposal received a majority of votes, which occurs in a very small but increasing proportion of cases. According to SEC rules, defeated resolutions may be resubmitted only if they pass certain election hurdles (percentage of affirmative votes).
Shareholder resolutions have been an important part of activist campaigns in several cases. For example, resolutions were effective at raising public awareness and thereby pressuring corporate management about investments in [[apartheid]] [[South Africa]], [[nuclear power]], and [[labor disputes]]. Given these results, resolutions have been spearheaded by several coordinating groups, including the [[AFL-CIO]] and the [[Interfaith Center on Corporate Responsibility]]. Governmental and labor union [[pension funds]] also have become involved in supporting and submitting shareholder resolutions.
A shareholder resolution to protest napalm manufacturer Dow Chemical resulted in a U.S. Supreme Court case called SEC v. MEDICAL COMMITTEE FOR HUMAN RIGHTS, 404 U.S. 403 (1972). The court decided that the case was moot due to Dow's agreeing to include the resolution on its proxy statement.<ref name = scotus>{{cite web|url=https://caselaw.findlaw.com/us-supreme-court/404/403.html |title=Sec V. Medical Committee For Human Rights | Findlaw |publisher=Caselaw.findlaw.com |date= |accessdate=2016-02-14}}</ref> The dissent argument by Justice Douglas encourages the SEC to facilitate more shareholder resolutions. "The philosophy of our times, I think, requires that such [404 U.S. 403, 410] enterprises be held to a higher standard than that of the "morals of the marketplace" which exalts a single-minded, myopic determination to maximize profits as the traditional be-all and end-all of corporate concern." <ref name = scotus/> [ ==References== <references/>
==Sources==
*AFL-CIO. "How to File a Shareholder Resolution" [http://www.aflcio.org/corporatewatch/paywatch/what2do/w_howshare.cfm] *Gartman, Grant A. ''The IRRC handbook on proxy voting duties and guideline development''. 1999 *Gray, Hillel. ''New Directions in the Investment and Control of Pension Funds''. DC: Investor Responsibility Research Center, 1983. *''Medical Committee for Human Rights v. SEC'' 432 F.2d 639 (DC Cir. 1970, cert. granted) 401 US 973 (1971) *SEC ''Shareholder Proposals'' Staff Legal Bulletin No. 14B, September 15, 2004 [https://www.sec.gov/interps/legal/cfslb14b.htm] *''Shareholder Activism'' IRRC *Simon, Powers and Gunnemann. ''The Ethical Investor'' Yale Univ. Press *Voorhes, Meg. "The Rising Tide of Shareholder Activism" DC: IRRC, 2005 {{Corporate titles}}
[[Category:Corporate governance]] [[Category:Resolutions (law)]] [[Category:Shareholders|Resolution]]

revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox person | honorific_prefix = | name = Dr Siraj Ali (Hon) | honorific_suffix = | image = | image_size = 220px | alt = | caption = | native_name = মুহাম্মদ সিরাজ আলি | native_name_lang = bn | birth_name = Muhammad Siraj Ali | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1955|11|24|df=y}} | birth_place = [[East Bengal]] (now [[Bangladesh]]) | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | resting_place = | residence = [[Stanford-le-Hope]], Essex, England | nationality = British | other_names = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = | occupation = [[Restaurateur]] | years_active = 1979–present | employer = | organization = | agent = | known_for = | notable_works = | style = | home_town = | salary = | net_worth = | height = | weight = | television = | title = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | movement = | opponents = | boards = | spouse = Begum Momtaj Khanom | partner = | children = 4 | parents = | relatives = | callsign = | awards = | module = | website = {{URL|http://www.maharajagroup.co.uk/}} | footnotes = }}
'''Muhammad Siraj Ali''' ({{lang-bn|মুহাম্মদ সিরাজ আলি}}; born 24 November 1954) is a Bangladeshi-born British [[restaurateur]] and philanthropist.
==Career== In 1979, Ali bought the New Curry Centre, in [[Stanford-le-Hope]]. At the time Ali's family was the first [[Bengali people|Bengali]] family in [[Thurrock]] [[Essex]].<ref name="thurrockgazette">{{cite news |last= |first= |url=http://www.thurrockgazette.co.uk/news/13951250.Q_A_with_Siraj_Ali__Meet_the_man_who_brought_Indian_cuisine_to_Thurrock/|title=Q&A with Siraj Ali: Meet the man who brought Indian cuisine to Thurrock|location=Thurrock|work= |publisher=''Thurrock Gazette''|date=8 November 2015|accessdate=1 December 2015}}</ref>
Ali runs the Maharaja restaurant in [[South Benfleet]], Essex.<ref name="echo1">{{cite news |last=McNally|first=Alex|url=http://www.echo-news.co.uk/news/4315631.Restaurant_boss_Siraj_praised_for_community_dedication/|title=Restaurant boss Siraj praised for community dedication|location=Essex|work= |publisher=''Echo''|date=25 April 2009|accessdate=1 January 2013}}</ref> Since 1991, the restaurant has held charity nights raising close to £2 million for hundreds of charitable causes including; [[Multiple Sclerosis Society of Great Britain|Multiple Sclerosis Society]], [[National Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children|NSPCC]], [[British Red Cross]] and Breast Cancer Awareness amongst others.<ref name="manchestereveningnews">{{cite news |last= |first= |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/local-news/bangladeshi-restaurant-entrepreneur-honoured-873613|title=Bangladeshi restaurant entrepreneur honoured|location=Manchester|work= |publisher=''[[Manchester Evening News]]''|date=19 October 2011|accessdate=1 January 2013}}</ref> Ali has been involved in the Indian catering industry since the 1970s, with a career spanning 40 years.<ref name="echo2">{{cite news |last= |first= |url=http://www.echo-news.co.uk/news/9322643.Restaurant_owner_awarded_for_work_in_catering/|title=Restaurant owner awarded for work in catering|location=Essex|work= |publisher=''Echo''|date=25 October 2011|accessdate=1 January 2013}}</ref><ref name="halsteadgazette">{{cite news |last= |first= |url=http://www.halsteadgazette.co.uk/news/south_essex_news/9322643.Restaurant_owner_awarded_for_work_in_catering/|title=Restaurant owner awarded for work in catering|location=Essex|work= |publisher=''Halstead Gazette''|date=25 October 2011|accessdate=1 January 2013}}</ref>
Ali is the founder chairman of both the Thurrock Bangladesh Welfare Association and the Thurrock Islamic Educational Cultural Centre. He is the general secretary of the Castle Point Bangladeshi Education and Cultural Centre, as well as governor of the Hajji Soyed Ali Primary School and the chairman of the advisory committee of the Essex Bangladesh Welfare Association.<ref name="echo1"/>
He is chairman of the Interim Committee Arbitrator and former treasurer of the Balagonj Education Trust, which aims to provide life skills and education to disadvantaged children in Bangladesh.<ref name="echo1"/> He is also vice-chairman of The Bangladeshi Catering Association (Essex region).<ref name="echo2"/><ref name="halsteadgazette"/>
==Awards and recognition== In 2009, Ali won the [[Channel S]] Award for years of charity work in south Essex.<ref name="echo1"/> In 2011, he was awarded the ''[[British Bangladeshi Who's Who]]'' 'Outstanding Contribution' Award for his long standing contribution to the hospitality and catering industry.<ref name="manchestereveningnews"/>
In 2009, Ali was the joint winner of the [[Bangladesh Caterers Association UK|Bangladesh Caterers Association]] 'Caterer of the Year' for the South East.<ref name="tandoorimagazine">{{cite news |last= |first= |url=http://www.tandoorimagazine.com/news/view/a_qcurrysmaticq_bangladeshi_caterers_association_annual_dinner|title=A "Currysmatic" Bangladeshi Caterers Association Annual Dinner|location= |work= |publisher=''[[Tandoori Magazine]]''|date=January 2010|accessdate=1 January 2013}}</ref> In 2015, he was awarded the Lifetime Achievement Award by ''[[Curry Life]]'' magazine.<ref name="thurrockgazette"/>
==Personal life== Ali lives in Stanford-le-Hope, Essex.<ref name="echo1"/> He is married to Begum Momtaj Khanom, and they have one son, Ansar, and three daughters, Shahena (who is a celebrity television chef on [[The Food Channel]])<ref name="thurrockgazette"/> Shareena and Jasmine.<ref name="bbwhoswho08">{{cite book |last1=Karim|first1=Mohammed Abdul|last2=Karim|first2=Shahadoth|title=British Bangladeshi Who's Who|url=http://www.bbwhoswho.co.uk/Profile/Ali,%20Mr%20Mohammed%20Siraj.pdf|date=July 2008|publisher=British Bangla Media Group|page=42|isbn= |accessdate=1 January 2013}}</ref><ref name="bbwhoswho09">{{cite book |last1=Karim|first1=Mohammed Abdul|last2=Karim|first2=Shahadoth|title=British Bangladeshi Who's Who|url=http://www.bbwhoswho.co.uk/whoswho_09.pdf|date=October 2009|publisher=British Bangla Media Group|page=30|isbn= |accessdate=1 September 2014}}</ref>
Ali has arranged around 200 charity events per year for 20 years, raising around £600 to £1,500 an event. It is estimated that he has helped raise £3 million for charity.<ref name="thurrockgazette"/>
==See also== * [[British Bangladeshi]] * [[Business of British Bangladeshis]] * [[List of British Bangladeshis]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.bbwhoswho.co.uk/Profile/Ali,%20Mr%20Mohammed%20Siraj.pdf Siraj Ali] on ''[[British Bangladeshi Who's Who]]'' * [http://www.maharajagroup.co.uk/ Maharaja Restaurant website] * [http://www.ethnicnow.com/channels/food-drink/press-release/11/1305/the-maharaja-wins-parliamentary-restaurant-award-from-ainsley-harriott-and-rt-hon-keith-vaz-mp.html The Maharaja Wins Parliamentary Restaurant Award from Ainsley Harriott and Rt Hon Keith Vaz MP]. ''Ethnic Now''. 24 July 2007 * [http://www.thurrockgazette.co.uk/news/13951250.Q_A_with_Siraj_Ali__Meet_the_man_who_brought_Indian_cuisine_to_Thurrock/ Q&A with Siraj Ali: Meet the man who brought Indian cuisine to Thurrock]. ''Thurrock Gazette''. 8 November 2015

{{Infobox company | name = Soda Industry Inc. | native_name = Soda Sanayii A.Ş. | founded = {{Start date and age|1969}} | location = [[Kazanlı]], [[Mersin]], [[Turkey]] | industry = [[Chemical industry|Chemicals]] | products = [[Soda ash]],
[[chromium compounds]] ,
[[sodium metabisulphite]],
[[vitamin K3]] | owner = Şişecam Group | employees = | architect = | style = | area = | volume = | address = | defunct = | website = {{URL|www.sodakrom.com}} | module = {{location map | Turkey | relief = yes | coordinates = {{coord|36|48|51|N|34|44|55|E}} | label = Soda Industry Inc. | caption = Loccation of the company in Turkey }} }} '''Soda Industry Inc.''' ({{lang-tr|Soda Sanayii A.Ş.}}, also called Sodakrom) is a chemical company in [[Mersin]], [[Turkey]] producing soda ash and chromium compounds mainly for the glass industry in its parent's group of companies. It is owned and operated by the Şişecam Group. The soda plant at {{coord|36|48|51|N|34|44|55|E}} is to the west of [[Kazanlı]] neighborhood in [[Akdeniz]] district of Mersin, southern Turkey. ==History== The Soda Industry Inc. was established in 1969 as a subsidiary of the Şişecam Group, Turkey's major glass producer. Production of soda ash ([[sodium carbonate]], [[sodium|Na2]][[carbon|C]][[oxygen|O3]]), a key raw material for the [[glass industry]], began in 1975. In 1979, the Kromsan Chromium Compounds Plant ({{lang-tr|Kromsan Krom Bileşikleri Fabrikası}}) was founded. It is situated just to the northwest of the Soda Plant. In 1982, it joined the Şişecam Chemicals Group, one of the four main businesses of Şişecam Group. In 1986, Kromsan merged with the Soda Industry company. Beginning by 1997, Soda Industry began foreign investments. Soda Industry acquired 25% share of the Bulgarian Soda factory Sodi in 1997 and all shares of the Bosnian soda factory Lukavac in 2006 to increase its soda production. In 2011 Soda Industry also acquired the Italian Chromium Products factory Cromital . The Soda Plant and the Kromsan Chromium Compounds Plant produce chemicals, which are used in a variety of industrial and consumer goods such as detergents, leather and pharmaceuticals. ==Production== Soda Industry now is the leading producer of chromium compounds and the 4th greatest producer of sodium compounds (such as [[sodium dichromate]] ([[sodium|Na2]][[chromium|Cr2]][[oxygen|O7]]), [[chromium(III) sulfate|basic chromium sulfate]] ([[[chromium|Cr2]]([[hydrogen|H2]][[oxygen|O]])6([[oxygen|O]][[hydrogen|H]])4][[sulfur|S]][[oxygen|O4]]) and [[chromic acid]] ([[hydrogen|H2]][[chromium|Cr]][[oxygen|O4]] ) with an annual production of 2.2 million metric tons in Europe. [[Vitamin K3]] and [[sodium metabisulphite]] are among the other products.[http://www.sisecamkimyasallar.com/sites/catalogs/tr/Documents/surdurulebilirlik-raporlari/SodaSanayiiAS_Surdurulebilirlik_Raporu.pdf Soda Sanayii sustainability report {{tr icon}}] ==References== {{reflist|30em|refs= [http://www.sisecamkimyasallar.com/en/about-us/history Şişecan history] {{cite web |url=http://www.sisecamkimyasallar.com/en/about-us/group-profile |publisher=Şişecam Chemicals |title=Group Profile |accessdate=2018-01-23 }} }} {{Mersin Province}} [[Category:Buildings and structures in Mersin]] [[Category:1969 establishments in Turkey]] [[Category:1979 establishments in Turkey]] [[Category:Akdeniz District]] [[Category:Chemical industry]] [[Category:Chromium compounds]] [[Category:Industrial buildings in Turkey]] [[Category:Companies based in Mersin]]

page.title: Synod of Bishops for the Pan-Amazon region

revision.comment: Robot - Moving category 21st-century Roman Catholicism to [[:Category:21st-century Catholicism]] per [[WP:CFD|CFD]] at [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2018 August 30]].
revision.text:
The '''Synod of Bishops for the Pan-Amazon region''' is scheduled to meet in Rome in October 2019. [[Pope Francis]] announced on 15 October 2017 that it would work "to identify new paths for the evangelization of God's people in that region", specifically the [[indigenous peoples]] who are experiencing the destruction and exploitation of their natural environment and live "often forgotten and without the prospect of a serene future".<ref>{{cite news|last1=Galleazzi|first1=Giacomo|title=A Synod for the indigenous peoples of South America|url=http://www.lastampa.it/2017/10/15/vaticaninsider/eng/world-news/a-synod-for-the-indigenous-peoples-of-south-america-bu6BcrTX8a4HWl645ztM6O/pagina.html|accessdate=23 October 2017|work=La Stampa|date=15 October 2017}}</ref>
The obstacles to evangelization include the difficult terrain that makes native populations hard to reach,<ref name=wantssynod /> the great variety of languages spoken, and the resistance of landowners and business interests. The [[Amazon basin|Amazon]], according to one Vatican report, covers six million sq.km. with a population of 2.8 million organized into 400 tribes that "speak some 240 languages belonging to 49 linguistic families".<ref name=repam /> The Synod defines the region to include all or part of [[Religion in Bolivia|Bolivia]], [[Religion in Brazil|Brazil]], [[Religion in Colombia|Colombia]], [[Religion in Ecuador|Ecuador]], [[Religion in French Guiana|French Guiana]], [[Religion in Guyana|Guyana]], [[Religion in Peru|Peru]], [[Religion in Venezuela|Venezuela]], and [[Religion in Surinam|Surinam]], all countries where most of the population is Catholic.<ref name=cruxannounce>{{cite news|last1=San Martín|first1=Inés|title=Pope announces Synod of Bishops for Pan-Amazon region| url=https://cruxnow.com/vatican/2017/10/15/pope-announces-synod-bishops-pan-amazon-region/|accessdate=23 October 2017| work=Crux|date=15 October 2017}}</ref>
[[Pope John Paul II]] called similar synods for the [[Catholicism in the Netherlands|Netherlands]] in 1980 and for [[Catholicism in Lebanon|Lebanon]] in 1995.<ref name=cruxannounce />
== Background == As early as 1912, in the encyclical ''[[Lacrimabili statu]]'', [[Pope Pius X]] denounced the owners of the [[rubber plantation]]s in Peru for mistreating the native population<ref>{{cite book|last1=Turvasi|first1=Francesco|title=Giovanni Genocchi and the Indians of South America, 1911–1913|date=1988|publisher=Editrice Pontifica Università Gregoriana|location=Rome|page=109|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=EpY6KqzBXHQC&pg=PA109&|accessdate=23 October 2017}}</ref> and condemned [[Order of Friars Minor Capuchin|Capuchin]] missionaries for failing to protect them.<ref>{{cite book|editor-last1=McLeod| editor-first1=Hugh|title=The Cambridge History of Christianity|date=2006|publisher=Cambridge University Press| page=183|volume=9: World Christianities c.1914-c.2000 |first=Christopher |last=Abel| chapter=Latin America, c.1914-c.1950 | url= https://books.google.com/books?id=Ms_SyCLNpuAC&pg=PA183&|accessdate=23 October 2017}}</ref>
Visiting Brazil in July 2013, Pope Francis said: "The Church's presence in the Amazon Basin is not that of someone with bags packed and ready to leave after having exploited everything possible. The Church has been present in the Amazon Basin from the beginning, in her [[missionaries]], [[Congregation (Catholic)|religious congregations]], [[priests]], [[laity]] and [[bishops]], and she is still present and critical to the area's future."<ref>{{cite news|title=Pope Francis calls for 'respect and protection' of environment, end to exploitation of Amazon rainforest| url=http://nationalpost.com/holy-post/pope-francis-calls-for-respect-and-protection-of-environment-end-to-exploitation-of-amazon-rainforest |accessdate=23 October 2017|work=National Post|date=27 July 2013}}</ref> Pope Francis' encyclical, ''[[Laudato si'|Laudato si{{'}}]]'' (2015), focused on the need to defend of the poor and their natural environment.<ref>{{cite news|title=The Guardian view on Laudato Si': Pope Francis calls for a cultural revolution| url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2015/jun/18/guardian-view-on-laudato-si-pope-francis-cultural-revolution|accessdate=23 October 2017| work=The Guardian|date=18 June 2015}}</ref>
Since March 2015, the Pan-Amazon Ecclesial Network (REPAM) has coordinated the work of the Catholic Church in the Amazon region, marshaling the work of priests and missionaries, national representatives of [[Caritas Internationalis|Caritas]] and lay advocates to protect the both indigenous peoples of the Amazon and the [[natural resources]] of the region from exploitation.<ref name=repam>{{cite news | work= Zenit | accessdate = 23 October 2017 | date = 2 March 2015 | title= Vatican Presents Initiative to Protect Amazon | url = https://zenit.org/articles/vatican-presents-initiative-to-protect-amazon/ }}</ref> Archbishop Salvador Pineiro García-Calderón of [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Ayacucho|Ayacucho]], President of the Peruvian Bishops' Conference, reported that Pope Francis proposed a synod devoted to the Amazon region in a meeting with the bishops of Peru in May 2017.<ref name=wantssynod>{{cite news|last1=Arocho Esteves|first1=Junno|title=Pope Francis wants synod dedicated to people in Amazon, archbishop says| url=https://www.americamagazine.org/faith/2017/05/16/pope-francis-wants-synod-dedicated-people-amazon-archbishop-says|accessdate=23 October 2017|work=America|agency=Catholic News Service |date=16 May 2017}}</ref> He mentioned it to the bishops of Ecuador in September 2017.<ref name=ecuador>{{cite news | work = Zenit | accessdate = 23 October 2017 | date= 28 September 2017 | url = https://zenit.org/articles/ecuador-pope-encourages-organizing-synod-on-the-church-in-amazonia/ | title = Ecuador: Pope Encourages Organizing Synod on the Church in Amazon}}</ref>
Francis visited Peru in January 2018 and was met by 4,000 members of the indigenous communities from the [[Amazon rainforest]]. He said that the people of the Amazon were threatened now more than ever, and questioned the conservationist policies that affect the Peruvian rainforest. In [[Puerto Maldonado]], he asked for the indigenous communities to be recognized as partners instead of minorities. He said that "all the efforts we make in order to regain the life of the peoples of the Amazon will always be too few". He called on the Peruvian people to put an end to practices that degrade women and criticized the sterilization of indigenous women.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://aa.com.tr/en/americas/pope-francis-visit-to-chile-and-peru-comes-to-an-end/1038139 |title=Pope Francis' visit to Chile and Peru comes to an end |access-date= 8 June 2018 |last= Serna Duque |first=Santiago |date=22 January 2018 |work= |publisher=Anadolu Agency }}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url = https://www.americamagazine.org/faith/2018/01/19/peru-pope-francis-says-church-stands-peoples-amazon-and-earth | first = Gerard | last= O'Connell | accessdate = 8 June 2018 | date= 19 January 2018 |title=In Peru, Pope Francis says the church stands with the peoples of the Amazon and the earth | work = [[America (magazine)|America]]}}</ref>
== See also == * [[Dorothy Stang]] * [[Latin American Episcopal Conference]] *[[Synod of Bishops in the Catholic Church]]
== References == {{Reflist|2}}
== External links == *[http://w2.vatican.va/content/pius-x/en/encyclicals/documents/hf_p-x_enc_07061912_lacrimabili-statu.html ''Lacrimabili Statu'', Encyclical of Pope Pius X on the Indians of South America, 7 June 1912]
[[Category:2019 in Christianity]] [[Category:2019 in Vatican City]] [[Category:21st-century Catholicism]] [[Category:Catholic missions]] [[Category:Christian missions in South America]] [[Category:Christianity and environmentalism]] <!-- Likely [[Category:Documents of the Catholic Social Teaching tradition]] --> [[Category:Indigenous rights]] <!-- Likely [[Category:Indigenous rights publications]] --> [[Category:October 2019 events]] [[Category:Pope Francis]] [[Category:Rubber industry]] [[Category:Synod of Bishops (Catholic)]]

revision.comment: Dating maintenance tags: {{Cn}}
revision.text:
'''Tangible common equity''' ('''TCE''') is the subset of [[shareholders' equity]] that is not [[preferred equity]] and not [[intangible asset]]s.<ref>[http://ftalphaville.ft.com/blog/2008/11/21/18538/tangled-tangibles/ "Tangled Tangibles", by Tracy Alloway] an [[FT Alphaville]] November 23, 2008 blog entry</ref><ref>[http://baselinescenario.com/2009/02/24/tangible-common-equity-for-beginners/ "Tangible Common Equity for Beginners"] from [[James Kwak|baselinescenario.com]]</ref>
TCE is an uncommonly used measure of a company's financial strength. It indicates how much [[ownership equity]] owners of [[common stock]] would receive in the event of a company's [[liquidation]]. During the financial and economic crisis of 2008–2009, it gained public popularity as a measure of the viability of large [[commercial banks]].
TCE, when used in a ratio with tangible common assets, is a measure of a bank's ability to absorb losses (e.g., [[Mortgage repossession|homeowners defaulting on mortgages]]) before becoming insolvent. It is one of the factors considered by the [[Office of the Comptroller of the Currency]] to determine if a bank has become insolvent.
==Formulae== *'''''TCE = total equity – intangible assets – goodwill – preferred stock'''''{{cn|date=December 2017}} *'''''TCE ratio = TCE / (total assets)'''''{{cn|date=December 2017}} *'''''Leverage ratio = (total assets – intangible assets – goodwill) / TCE'''''{{cn|date=December 2017}}
==Example== On February 27, 2009, the [[Federal government of the United States|U.S. Government]] converted [[preferred shares]] to [[common shares]] in order to increase [[Citigroup]]'s tangible common equity.<ref>[https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB123573983418294221?mod=googlenews_wsj "Citi to Exchange Preferred Securities for Common, Increasing Tangible Common Equity to as Much as $81 Billion", [[Wall Street Journal]], February 27, 2009]</ref> In this example, preferred stock equity is decreased, and total equity remains the same, increasing the TCE.
==See also== *[[Bank stress tests]] *[[Return on tangible equity]]
==References== <references />
{{econ-term-stub}} {{stock market}}
[[Category:Balance sheet]] [[Category:United States Generally Accepted Accounting Principles]]

revision.comment: Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/191.13.143.60|191.13.143.60]] ([[User talk:191.13.143.60|talk]]): Rv acronym. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
revision.text:
{{distinguish|Teleconnection}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} [[File:Erdfunkstelle Raisting 2.jpg|thumb|[[Earth station]] at the satellite communication facility in Raisting, Bavaria, Germany]] [[File:Internet map 1024.jpg|thumb|Visualization from the [[Opte Project]] of the various routes through a portion of the Internet]]
'''Telecommunication''' is the [[Transmission (telecommunications)|transmission]] of signs, signals, messages, words, writings, images and sounds or information of any nature by [[wire]], [[radio]], optical or [[electromagnetic]] systems.<ref>{{citation |publisher=[[International Telecommunication Union]] |title=[[ITU Radio Regulations]] |chapter=Article 1.3 |chapter-url=http://www.itu.int/dms_pub/itu-s/oth/02/02/S02020000244501PDFE.PDF |date=2012}}</ref><ref>Constitution and Convention of the International Telecommunication Union, Annex (Geneva, 1992)</ref> Telecommunication occurs when the exchange of [[information]] between [[communication]] participants includes the use of [[technology]]. It is transmitted either electrically over physical media, such as [[electrical cable|cables]], or via [[electromagnetic radiation]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://education.yahoo.com/reference/dictionary/entry/telecommunication |title=Definition of telecommunication |work=Yahoo |accessdate=28 February 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130501055117/http://education.yahoo.com/reference/dictionary/entry/telecommunication |archivedate=1 May 2013 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.collinsdictionary.com/dictionary/english/telecommunication |title=Telecommunication |work= Collins English Dictionary |accessdate=28 February 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.vocabulary.com/dictionary/telecommunication |title=Telecommunication |work= Vocabulary.com |accessdate=28 February 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/telecommunication |title=Telecommunication |work= Merriam-Webster Dictionary |accessdate=28 February 2013}}</ref><ref name="oxford">{{cite web |url=http://oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/telecommunication?view=uk |title=Telecommunication |work=Oxford Dictionaries |publisher=Oxford University Press |accessdate=28 February 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/telecommunication?r=66 |title=Telecommunication |work=Dictionary.com |accessdate=28 February 2013}}</ref> Such transmission paths are often divided into [[communication channel]]s which afford the advantages of [[multiplexing]]. Since the [[Latin]] term ''communicatio'' is considered the social process of information exchange, the term '''telecommunications''' is often used in its plural form because it involves many different technologies.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=SnjGRDVIUL4C&pg=PA3&lpg#v=onepage&q&f=false|title=The Worldwide History of Telecommunications|last=Huurdeman|first=Anton A.|date=31 July 2003|publisher=John Wiley & Sons|isbn=9780471205050|language=en}}</ref>
Early means of communicating over a distance included visual signals, such as [[beacon]]s, [[smoke signal]]s, [[semaphore line|semaphore telegraphs]], [[signal flag]]s, and optical [[heliograph]]s.<ref>Websters definition: "2) technology that deals with telecommunication —usually used in plural"; Concise Encyclopedia definition: "Communication n parties at a distance from one another...."; and the Online Etymology Dictionary: "telecommunication (n.) 1932, from French télécommunication (see tele- + communication)."; and: " 1930s: from French télécommunication, from télé- 'at a distance' + communication 'communication{{'"}}, Oxford online.</ref> Other examples of pre-modern long-distance communication included audio messages such as coded [[drum (communication)|drumbeats]], lung-blown [[Horn (instrument)|horns]], and loud whistles. 20th- and 21st-century technologies for long-distance communication usually involve electrical and electromagnetic technologies, such as [[electrical telegraph|telegraph]], [[telephone]], and [[teleprinter]], [[telecommunication network|networks]], [[radio]], [[microwave transmission]], [[Fiber-optic communication|fiber optics]], and [[communications satellite]]s.
A revolution in [[wireless communication]] began in the first decade of the 20th century with the pioneering developments in [[radio communications]] by [[Guglielmo Marconi]], who won the [[Nobel Prize in Physics]] in 1909, and other notable pioneering inventors and developers in the field of electrical and electronic telecommunications. These included [[Charles Wheatstone]] and [[Samuel F.B. Morse|Samuel Morse]] (inventors of the [[telegraph]]), [[Alexander Graham Bell]] (inventor of the telephone), [[Edwin Armstrong]] and [[Lee de Forest]] (inventors of radio), as well as [[Vladimir K. Zworykin]], [[John Logie Baird]] and [[Philo Farnsworth]] (some of the inventors of [[television]]).
== Etymology == The word ''telecommunication'' is a compound of the Greek prefix ''tele'' (τηλε), meaning ''distant'', ''far off'', or ''afar'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=tele-&allowed_in_frame=0|title=Online Etymology Dictionary|publisher=}}</ref> and the Latin ''communicare'', meaning ''to share''. Its modern use is adapted from the French,<ref name="oxford"/> because its written use was recorded in 1904 by the French engineer and novelist [[Édouard Estaunié]].<ref>Jean-Marie Dilhac, [http://www.ieee.org/portal/cms_docs_iportals/iportals/aboutus/history_center/conferences/che2004/Dilhac.pdf From tele-communicare to Telecommunications], 2004.</ref><ref>''Telecommunication'', ''tele-'' and ''communication'', [[New Oxford American Dictionary]] (2nd edition), 2005.</ref> ''Communication'' was first used as an English word in the late 14th century. It comes from Old French comunicacion (14c., Modern French communication), from Latin communicationem (nominative communicatio), noun of action from past participle stem of communicare "to share, divide out; communicate, impart, inform; join, unite, participate in", literally "to make common", from communis".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=communication&allowed_in_frame=0|title=Online Etymology Dictionary|publisher=}}</ref>
== History == {{details|History of telecommunication}}
=== Beacons and pigeons === [[File:OptischerTelegraf.jpg|upright|thumb|A replica of one of [[Claude Chappe|Chappe's]] [[semaphore tower]]s]]
